Android App

Mobile development using Java

In my specialization course in IT we had one week in pairs to develop an app using Android Studio and Java. It had to use at least one captor of the mobile phone and a bluetooth or sms sending function. The app was ready on time, sending sms after succeeding some balance and reflex challenges, but their is a lot of functionnalities we would like to add to it, so we could launch it on the Google Play Store. Another version in Swift for iOS users is also in progress.

  • Date: October 2020
  • Category: Academic project

BNEI

National Engineering Student Council

The BNEI -Bureau National des Élèves Ingénieurs- is th national engineering student council in France. I'm the communication manager of the association. Everyday I work with a team of 50+ people, and I directly manage 3 of them for producing and publishing all the contents of the association. This engagement made me more autonome, productive, and I'm still learning everyday !

  • Date: Since March 2020
  • Category: Volonteering engagement

Equalizer

Civilization-like game mage with JS and Phazer

In semester 6 we had to develope an application that offered at least one solution to the sustainable development objectives. With my two other team mates we decided to create a civilization-like game to sensibilize about climate change. In Equalizer you raise your own civilization, and you have to guide your people so they produce the least polution possible, at the risk of suffering the consequencies of climate change !

  • Date: April to June 2020
  • Category: Academic project

La Nuit de l'ENIB

Association in charge the the school's gala

La Nuit de l'ENIB is in charge of organizing the gala diner and evening of the ENIB each year. I was at first secretary from April 2018 to April 2019, I have then been elected president, which I am still today. We had to postpone the last edition of the gala due to the pandemic, but all our team is working hard to offer our students and young graduate the best event possible !

  • Date: Since April 2018
  • Category: Volonteering engagement

Arduino project

Security project with signal processing

Kind of bored watching tv during the summer break, I decided to learn a bit more about signal processing. I first tried to code a voice recognition with scilab, but I then moved to Python and started to design an electronic system based on an Arduino linked to a Raspberry pi. The goal was to detect when a door is opened, to ask who is trying to enter the room, register that person talking and then check if this person is authorized or not. If not, an alarm is activated.

  • Date: July 2019
  • Category: Personnal project

Murder Party

Creation of a game about climat change

During the SEDD - Semaine Étudiante du Développement Durable or Student Week of Sustainable Development -, I created a Murder Party for an activity organized by the ENIB's sustainable development club, in collaboration with the Game club manager.

  • Date: April 2019
  • Category: Volonteering engagement
